content: I've noticed more than once that I'd like to check my NNG answers against the "canonical" style to see if I missed some opportunities to simplify. Some levels have canonical answers at the end, but not all of them. I did find some solutions in https://github.com/ImperialCollegeLondon/natural_number_game/tree/master/src/game but that's for the old version of the game. Is there a canonical list of solutions for the new version? Is this planned or even desirable?

Dan Abramov said:

Is there a canonical list of solutions for the new version?

For the current 5 games on the Lean Game Server these are the locations of the GitHub repositories that I have found. Did not verify if they exactly match those of the server but they worked for the games I played.

1. Natural Number Game - https://github.com/leanprover-community/NNG4
2. Robo (currently on in German) - https://github.com/hhu-adam/Robo
3. Set Theory Game - https://github.com/djvelleman/STG4
4. A Lean intro to Logic - https://github.com/Trequetrum/lean4game-logic
5. Reasoning - https://github.com/JadAbouHawili/KnightsAndKnaves-Lean4Game

Each repository will include a directory structure of Game then Levels with the individual levels as a uniquely named folder and then all of the lean files for that level. In the Lean file is the code used for the game along with all of the hints and the final solution and other possible solutions.

HTH
Ah thank you! I missed the lines of the actual solution between the hints in the level folders.
Dan Abramov has marked this topic as resolved.
